quotes.quote: Throw off your worries when you throw off your clothes at night.
All I wish a sheet of clouds for your bed and bright crystals for the stars. While you sleep, may the angels play sweet songs that bring you bright dreams.
Even the darkest night will end and the sun will rise.
As the night gets dark, let your worries fade. sleep peacefully knowing you've done all you can do for today.
The best bridge between despair and hope is a good night's sleep.
The sea will grant each man new hope, and sleep will bring dreams of home.
It is better to sleep on things beforehand than lie awake about them afterwards.
I just want to say, good night, sweet prince, may flights of angels sing thee to thy rest.
Night is the wonderful opportunity to take rest, to forgive, to smile, to get ready for all the battles that you have to fight tomorrow.
Good night, good night! Parting is such sweet sorrow, that I shall say good night till it be morrow.
The darkest night is often the bridge to the brightest tomorrow.
Good night - may you fall asleep in the arms of a dream, so beautiful, you'll cry when you awake.
As the moonlight dims and the world goes quiet, give yourself some rest. Here's to hoping that your sleep is as sweet as you are.
Always end the day with a positive thought. No matter how hard things were, tomorrow's a fresh opportunity to make it better.
Never let the darkness or negativity outside affect your inner self. Just wait until morning comes and the bright light will drown out the darkness.
The longest way must have its close — the gloomiest night will wear on to a morning.
Sleeping is no mean art: for its sake one must stay awake all day.
A ruffled mind makes a restless pillow.
I love the silent hour of night, For blissful dreams may then arise,Revealing to my charmed sight, What may not bless my waking eyes.
Each night, when I go to sleep, I die. And the next morning, when I wake up, I am reborn.
Don't fight with the pillow, but lay down your head and kick every worriment out of the bed.
Day is over, night has come. today is gone, what's done is done. embrace your dreams, through the night, tomorrow comes with a whole new light.
Night is a time of rigor, but also of mercy.
You are the reason why I have sleepless nights. You are the reason why I tend to hold my pillow tight. And you are the reason I can't sleep without saying goodnight.
Night is always darker before the dawn and life is the same, the hard times will pass, every thing will get better and sun will shine brighter then ever.
Disappointment always arrives before hope and the darkness of night comes before the dawn. Don't lose hope now because things will brighter with the new day.
This is the end of the day, but soon there will be a new day.
This is the end of the day, but soon there will be a new day. Keep your spirits up because there are always more chances.
The stars and moon arrive just to wish you a good night. Let the light of the moon guide your dreams as you pass the night away.
You can't change everything in one night, but one night can change everything.
Silently, one by one, / in the infinite windows of heaven, / Blossomed the lovely stars, / the forget-me-nots of the angels.
Night's the better half of life.
No more words. In the name of this place / we drink with our breathing, / stay quiet like a flower. / So the nightbirds will start singing.
Empty yourself of everything. / Let the mind rest at peace.
Good night now, and rest. / Today was a test. / You passed it, you're past it. / Now breathe till unstressed.
Good night! / Good night! / Let's make some new mistakes! / Let's stumble toward success and pack some snacks for little breaks!
Good night. / Courage. / Even when fear is at the foot of your bed, courage. / Let's go.
Good night. / I'm tired. I bet you're tired. / But we're awake and alive and that's enough. Cmon. / Cmon.
Good night. / Take care of each other. / Take care of yourself. / Repeat.
Hush! my dear, lie still and slumber; / Holy angels guard thy bed! / Heavenly blessings without number / Gently falling on thy head.
Oft in the stilly night / E'er slumber's chain has bound me, / Fond Memory brings the light / Of other days around me.
I close my eyes, then I drift away, into the magic night I softly say. A silent prayer, like dreamers do, then I fall asleep to dream my dreams of you.
Send me the words 'Good night' to put under my pillow.
Some people forget that love is / tucking you in and kissing you / “Good night” / no matter how young or old you are
We are such stuff / As dreams are made on, and our little life / Is rounded with a sleep.
When the sun goes down, the birds on the trees / Are singing sweet for the night / When the sun says good night to the mountain / I am dreaming of the sun / Say good night

quotes.cite: Johannes Brahms, Brian Kim, John Charles Edward Swihart
quotes.quote: Lullaby and good night / In the sky stars are bright / 'Round your head / Flowers gay / Set you slumbers till day
Lullaby / And good night / In the skies stars are bright / May the moon's silvery beams / Bring you sweet dreams
So fill to me the parting glass / And drink a health whate’er befalls / And gently rise and softly call / Good night and joy be to you all

Lullaby and good night, with roses bestride, / With lilies bedecked. 'neath Baby's sweet bed. / May thou sleep, may thou rest, may thy slumber be blest. / May thou sleep, may thou rest, may thy slumber be blest.
Close your eyes and I'll close mine / Good night sleep tight / Now the sun turns out his light / Good night sleep tight / Dream sweet dreams for me / Dream sweet dreams for you.
Good night, my love / Pleasant dreams and sleep tight my love / May tomorrow be sunny and bright / And bring you closer to me

Good night, my love, the tired old moon is descending. / Good night, my love, my moment with you is now ending. / It was so heavenly, holding you close to me. / It will be heavenly to hold you again in a dream.

quotes.cite: Jimmy Campbell, Ray Noble, Reg Connelly
quotes.quote: Good night, sweetheart, tho' I'm not beside you / Good night, sweetheart, still my love will guide you / Dreams enfold you, in each one I'll hold you / Good night sweetheart, good night
Sleep well, my love, on night's dark breast, / And ease thy soul with slumber bright; / Be joy but thine and I am blest. / Good-night, my love, good-night, good-night.
Good-night? ah! no; the hour is ill/ Which severs those it should unite; / Let us remain together still, / Then it will be good night.
To hearts which near each other move / From evening close to morning light, / The night is good; because, my love, / They never say good-night.
My lips no other words can say, / But still they murmur and repeat / To you, who slumber far away, / Good night, my love! / good night, my sweet!
Thy head lies pillowed on my breast— / My cheek upon thy brow— / Dear love, good night! Thou art at rest / From Past and Future now.
Good-night! Now dwindle down and low / The embers of the afterglow, / And slowly over leaf and lawn / In twilight's dewy curtain drawn.
Forsaken love, its last tear shed, / On the lone pillow lays its head, / And all our woes are respited: / Good-night!
